pullRequest.body:
Defines some useful properties of `ContinuousConstSMul` group actions on Hausdorff spaces:
- `MulAction.isClosed_fixedBy`, which proves that the `fixedBy α m` set is closed
- `t2_separation_smul`, which constructs an open set `s` such that `s` and `g • s` are disjoint
- `Set.InjOn.t2_separation_smul`, the extension of `t2_separation_smul` to a set of group elements whose action is injective

---

This PR belongs my series of PR around the formalization of Rubin's theorem. `MulAction.isClosed_fixedBy` is used in several places along the proof, and the separation lemmas are primarily used in showing that `(fixedBy α g)ᶜ` and `(fixedBy α h)ᶜ` are disjoint under some intricate but fully group-theoretic condition.

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: @ADedecker is the `separation_mul` stuff subsumed by any of the work from LftCM? If not, this LGTM.
I'll have a look very soon, thanks for pinging me.

Sorry for the delay. I think there is no overlap with the theory of proper actions nor any of the work done at LftCM here. 

I think one thing that would be nice is to establish all of these properties for finite sets of homeomorphisms instead of requiring that they come from group actions (and then of course specialize it to the current statement). One could argue that we should just see `Homeomorph X` as a group acting on `X`, but I don't think we have this as an instance in Mathlib (?) so it's best to do things the other way around.

I wouldn't mind seeing the `MulAction (Homeomorph X) X` instance being introduced, as the article I'm following mentions this action as the trivial example for a Rubin action (although it's not needed for the proof itself). It's been a couple of weeks since I've touched Mathlib, but I'll see how I can generalize these results
Can you make this proof shorter by proving it after the result below?
Definitely, yes. Originally I had a very complex proof that proved the `Set.Finite` version using `t2_separation_smul`

It unfortunately makes the proof longer, because `PairwiseDisjoint` and `InjOn` require me to jump through more hoops; here it is, though, if this version is preferred. I can also easily revert the commit

style
```suggestion
  let ⟨t, t_open, x_in_t, pw_disj⟩ := Set.InjOn.t2_separation_smul inj (toFinite {g, 1})
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Algebra/ConstMulAction): properties of continuous actions in Hausdorff spaces

nodes.body: @ADedecker is the `separation_mul` stuff subsumed by any of the work from LftCM? If not, this LGTM.
I'll have a look very soon, thanks for pinging me.

Sorry for the delay. I think there is no overlap with the theory of proper actions nor any of the work done at LftCM here. 

I think one thing that would be nice is to establish all of these properties for finite sets of homeomorphisms instead of requiring that they come from group actions (and then of course specialize it to the current statement). One could argue that we should just see `Homeomorph X` as a group acting on `X`, but I don't think we have this as an instance in Mathlib (?) so it's best to do things the other way around.

I wouldn't mind seeing the `MulAction (Homeomorph X) X` instance being introduced, as the article I'm following mentions this action as the trivial example for a Rubin action (although it's not needed for the proof itself). It's been a couple of weeks since I've touched Mathlib, but I'll see how I can generalize these results
